TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TrafficStats extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Class that provides network traffic statistics.

remarks.para: Class that provides network traffic statistics. These statistics include bytes transmitted and received and network packets transmitted and received, over all interfaces, over the mobile interface, and on a per-UID basis.
These statistics may not be available on all platforms. If the statistics are not supported by this device, will be returned.

remarks.para: Clear any active tag set to account traffic originating from the current thread.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int64 GetUidRxBytes(int32 uid) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return number of bytes received by the given UID since device boot.

remarks.para: Return number of bytes received by the given UID since device boot. Counts packets across all network interfaces, and always increases monotonically since device boot. Statistics are measured at the network layer, so they include both TCP and UDP usage.
Before , this may return on devices where statistics aren't available.

.method public static hidebysig void IncrementOperationCount(int32 operationCount) cil managed

Docs.param: Number of operations to increment count by.
Docs.summary: Increment count of network operations performed under the accounting tag currently active on the calling thread.

remarks.para: Increment count of network operations performed under the accounting tag currently active on the calling thread. This can be used to derive bytes-per-operation.

Docs.summary: Return number of bytes received across mobile networks since device boot.

remarks.para: Return number of bytes received across mobile networks since device boot. Counts packets across all mobile network interfaces, and always increases monotonically since device boot. Statistics are measured at the network layer, so they include both TCP and UDP usage.
Before , this may return on devices where statistics aren't available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void TagSocket(class Java.Net.Socket socket) cil managed

Docs.summary: Tag the given with any statistics parameters active for the current thread.

remarks.para: Tag the given with any statistics parameters active for the current thread. Subsequent calls always replace any existing parameters. When finished, call to remove statistics parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int ThreadStatsTag { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Get the active tag used when accounting traffic originating from the current thread.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the active tag used when accounting traffic originating from the current thread. Only one active tag per thread is supported. .

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set active tag to use when accounting traffic originating from the current thread. Only one active tag per thread is supported.
Changes only take effect during subsequent calls to .
Tags between 0xFFFFFF00 and 0xFFFFFFFF are reserved and used internally by system services like when performing traffic on behalf of an application.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Return number of bytes received since device boot.

remarks.para: Return number of bytes received since device boot. Counts packets across all network interfaces, and always increases monotonically since device boot. Statistics are measured at the network layer, so they include both TCP and UDP usage.
Before , this may return on devices where statistics aren't available.
